RECOVER_PYTEST_COLLECTION_HANG.title: Recover Pytest Collection: Diagnosis & Structural Fix
RECOVER_PYTEST_COLLECTION_HANG.instruction_raw:
Pytest collection is experiencing a terminal 'stuck' point (hang) that occurs BEFORE root conftest.py telemetry can even log.
        This is not a simple performance bottleneck, but a structural block.

        1. [Diagnosis] Identify the 'Entry Point' block: Analyze 'main.py', 'config/__init__.py', and root-level '__init__.py' files for global initialization code.
        2. [Fix] Hypothesis - Deadlock/Global Contention: If you find file locks (PlatformLockManager), singletons, or DB connections triggered during import, ISOLATE them.
        3. [Fix] Audit 'pytest.ini' & Dependencies: Ensure heavy deps (sklearn, joblib) don't deadlock during test discovery.
        4. [Mandate] Implement a structural fix to ensure core initialization ONLY triggers during runtime, not during test discovery.
        5. [Verification] Run 'pytest --collect-only' to confirm the hang is resolved.
